author: chfast
content:
There is some confusion about the latest ethereum/tests release (cc <@259648573401071617>):
1. The EIPTests/StateTests/stEIP2537 contains outdated tests for BLS precompiles. These probably should be completely deleted.
2. ethereum/tests imports EEST in `Pyspecs` directories, but I don't see Prague tests there.

author: danceratopz
content: About 2. I would recommend running EEST tests from EEST release tarballs, not from ethereum/tests. EEST will probably release more frequently than ethereum/tests. There's a new EEST release planned for later today, btw.

author: chfast
content: I agree on this and this is what evmone is doing (I recommend to keep the list of the test sources in a CI config, not as git submodules). That's why my opinion is to remove any EEST tests from ethereum/tests not to give false sense of "all tests are here". (it will also save me time executing the same tests twice ðŸ˜‰ )

author: jochembrouwer
content: I agree here, tests should move one way (ethereum/tests -> EEST) and not the other way around or both ðŸ™‚

author: jochembrouwer
content: Now let's review this PR line-by-line ðŸ™‚
